title: Global Corporations and Power
description:
Global corporations now shape public life in countries
across the world. Besides influencing governments
and international organizations, they also directly
operate services which were once the domain of
government. This module investigates corporations
as actors involved, often informally, in emerging
configurations of power. Topics to be addressed
include the roles of corporations in international
financial institutions, in advising governments, in
delivering overseas assistance, in writing treaties, and
in otherwise participating in public life.
prerequisite: Completed 80MCs, including 28MCs in GL/GL recognised non-language modules, 28MCs in PS, with a minimum CAP of 3.20 or be on the Honours track.
